timeline.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: Make that method public and call it from this test since they are both in the same module.
replies.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Should this method then be @Nullable  and/or in the parent class?
timeline.author: iemejia

replies.bodyText:
It should be in the parent class.
@robertwb was going to take a look at fixing up the docs and method signatures to ensure that null, None, nil were allowed and what they meant under certain scenarios.
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: I can update  java RestrictionTracker within this PR if that's preferable.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: I am ok with null but couldn't we have modelled this with something Option type friendly like UnsplittableResult maybe with a isSplittable() method to resolve the case difference?
replies.author: iemejia

replies.bodyText:
Since restriction trackers return RestrictionT, we could only do this if we updated the trySplit method to return SplitResult<RestrictionT> where SplitResult would be something like Optional.
That could be useful if we wanted to plumb the failure reason for the split back to the runner.
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: The trySplit has returned SplitResult<RestrictionT> as result. If we want the runner understand the failure reason, we also need to create a set of well known literals. If just for logging purpose, we can also log the msg at SDK level.
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: Semantically, what we want to return here is the empty split. It is important that the infrastructure be able to recognize and empty split (of type RestrictionT) so that it won't try to further split/reschedule it. One could create a new SplitResult type for Java, but I'm unconvinced it's worth its weight. (Certainly None/nil feel more appropriate for Python and Go respectively.)
replies.author: robertwb

timeline.author: iemejia

timeline.message: Update trySplit logic to treat checkpoint specially.

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * position. Each claimed position should be a valid split point.
          
          
            
               * position. Each claimed position MUST be a valid split point.
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: We should make it clear that a checkpoint must return a valid split result or null where null represents that there is no residual.
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -80,6 +81,7 @@
    *     represent based upon the current known remaining amount of work.
    * @return a {@link SplitResult} if a split was possible, otherwise returns {@code null}.

timeline.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText:
I think the major question is about startKey == endKey or NO_KEYS. There are 2 options in my mind:

Use startKey == endKey and NO_KEYS to represent an empty key range.
Only use NO_KEYS as a notion of empty key range. In order to do this, we need to change the current range to NO_KEYS after checkpointing if necessary.
I chose option 2 as my current implementation, that's why I only exam NO_KEYS in tryClaim and checkDone.

What do you think?
replies.author: boyuanzz

replies.bodyText: A user can still create a restriction where startkey == endkey, have no tryClaim calls and be checkpointed which is why we need to support both cases.
replies.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: We should return [startKey, startKey) as the primary unless startKey is "" and then we should return NO_KEYS
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: I would get rid of this local variable since its not being computed and is always range.getEndKey(). We can see that it doesn't add value since you use range.getEndKey() and not endKey below.
timeline.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: When there is a split, the range is updated first before constructing residual. Thus stashing endKey is needed unless we create another local var to stash residual.
replies.author: boyuanzz

timeline.author: lukecwik
lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: We should cover the case where start == end at the NO_KEYS check at the top since it would be valid to be done and not have attempted anything because of how checkpoint is implemented.
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -156,6 +181,11 @@ public void checkDone() throws IllegalStateException {
       return;

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * @return a {@link SplitResult} if a split was possible, otherwise returns {@code null}. A
          
          
            
               *     checkpoint(fractionOfRemainder == 0) must either return a valid split result or null which
          
          
            
               *     means there is no more left work.
          
          
            
               * @return a {@link SplitResult} if a split was possible, otherwise returns {@code null}. If the {@code fractionOfRemainder == 0}, a {@code null} result MUST imply that the restriction tracker is done and there is no more work left to do.
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -78,8 +79,11 @@
    *
    * @param fractionOfRemainder A hint as to the fraction of work the primary restriction should
    *     represent based upon the current known remaining amount of work.
-   * @return a {@link SplitResult} if a split was possible, otherwise returns {@code null}.
+   * @return a {@link SplitResult} if a split was possible, otherwise returns {@code null}. A
+   *     checkpoint(fractionOfRemainder == 0) must either return a valid split result or null which
+   *     means there is no more left work.

timeline.bodyText: Add a tryClaim test for empty ranges covering NO_KEYS and when startKey == endKey
timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Why is the primary here 0x00 for the start key and not ByteKey.EMPTY?
timeline.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: It should be EMPTY. Thanks for catching this!
replies.author: boyuanzz

timeline.author: lukecwik

timeline.bodyText: Cover the case where startKey == endKey and also add a call for trySplit at 0.5
timeline.author: lukecwik
